root.name: Phantom Fighter
root.description: OverviewPhantom Fighter is known as Reigen Doushi in Japan, and is named after (and based on) the Japanese release of the 1985 kung fu comedy horror movie Mr Vampire, in which a Taoist priest and his two bumbling apprentices attempt to fight off a jiang shi (or kyonshi, as they're called in Japan) and other undead menaces.The game puts the player in control of Master Kao as he fights off vampires in one-on-one fights by entering homes infested with the creatures. Successfully defeating the jiang shi reduces it to flames and the player receives the gratitude of the house's owner, occasionally with the added benefit of being allowed to rest there and regain health. After defeating a certain number of regular jiang shi, a special boss version must be fought in a nearby cave before moving onto the next town.The player can also acquire red orbs from fallen foes, which can then be spent in training halls to acquire new moves. Inexplicably, the player must answer several simple trivia questions before being allowed to train.
